greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least value of k such that n!/((n-k)!)^2 is an integer.
comment: If p is the first prime > n/2, then a(n) > n-p. - _Robert Israel_, Jun 27 2018
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{i = 1, t = Table[n!/(n - k)!^2, {k, n}]}, While[ !IntegerQ[ t[[i]]], i++ ]; i]; Table[ f[n], {n, 75}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 03 2004 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 01 2004
ext: Edited, corrected and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 03 2004
